com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface createChainedOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface createChainedOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createChainedOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createChainedOrder API is used to create chained orders from the product lines of an existing order.

    • Method Detail

      • createChainedOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document createChainedOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException

        The createChainedOrder API is used to create chained orders from the product lines of an existing order. The createChainedOrder API can also update existing chained orders, by adding the new lines to the existing chained order. The existing chained orders must be identified by the determineChainedOrderForConsolidation user exit. If the user exit is not implemented, or if the user exit returns a null document,the createChainedOrder API creates a new chained order.

        The transaction for creating chained orders is provided in the factorysetup. The Transaction ID is CHAINED_ORDER_CREATE. The user cannot provide a transaction ID.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        The OrderLine of the parent order will be referred to as parent line and OrderLine of the derived order, will be referred to as derived line.

        A parent line can be part of multiple chained lines. Partial chaining is allowed. The starting status of parent lines for chaining is 1600 -AwaitingChainedOrderCreation. If the chained line is successfully created, the quantity in the parent line that is chained has a status of 2100 - ChainedOrderCreated.

        If it is not possible to chain lines from the parent order, no error is thrown.

        Parent lines which belong to the same order can be grouped to form more than one chained order.
        By default, parent lines are grouped by the Owner organization of the ShipNode in the OrderLineSchedules, or the SourceFromOrganization, if the ShipNode is not present. One parent line can create multiple chained lines, if the parent line has multiple schedules with different ShipNode owners. Additional grouping attributes for parent lines are provided in the ChainedOrderConsolidationTemplate, stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. The ChainedOrderConsolidationTemplate contains only the OrderLine element and its child element Item. All the grouping attributes must be OrderLine and Item attributes. This template must be present and must contain at least an empty OrderLine element. If the template contains an empty OrderLine element, all the chained lines become part of one order. The DocumentType of the chained order is associated with a ChainedOrderConsolidationTemplate.

        The parent order and the chained order have the same Enterprise. The Seller on the parent order becomes the buyer on the chained order. The ShipNode Owner or SourceFromOrganization of parent line's schedule becomes the Seller Organization of the corresponding chained order.The CHAINED_ORDER_CREATE transaction should be associated with a ChainedDocumentType, stored in the YFS_TRANSACTION table. The ChainedDocumentType is assigned as the DocumentType of the chained order when the chained order is created.

        If a chained order is being created, the grouping attributes are input to createOrder as OrderHeader attributes of the chained order.

        The EarliestShipDates of all the parent lines in a group are examined, and the minimum of these is stamped an the Header level ReqShipDate of the newly-created chained order. The same procedure is done for ReqDeliveryDate of the parent Order by using the minimum value of the EarliestDeliveryDate of the parent lines. If the group of parent lines are being included in an existing chained order, the dates of the chained order cannot be modified by calling the CreateChainedOrder API.

        A DefaultTemplateOrder may exists for the Buyer, Seller, Enterprise and TemplateOrderDocumentType combination for the derived order. If a DefaultTemplateOrder exists for the new derived order, the remaining header information is taken from this DefaultTemplateOrder, using the template CreateOrderDefaultTemplate, which is stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. The CreateOrderDefaultTemplate is chosen from the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table based on the document type of the derived order.

        If the DefaultTemplateOrder does not supply PersonInfoBillTo information, the new chained order uses the billing address information of the chained order's Buyer, which is the Seller of the parent order.

        The information from parent lines populated into the chained lines depends on the ChainedOrderDefaultTemplate. The ChainedOrderDefaultTemplate is based on OrderLine, and should not default values for attributes that are keys, such as OrderLineKey, OrderLineScheduleKey. See the OrderLine element of the YFS_createOrder_input.xml. If ChainedOrderDefaultTemplate allows OrderLineOption and its CustomAttributes, they are copied from parent order to new chained order.
        A line's Schedule attributes LotNumber and Quantity are propagated from the parent line to derived lines only if the Schedules element is present in the ChainedOrderDefaultTemplate.

        If the ChainedOrderDefaultTemplateOrder exists, and it has a value for any of these:
        PersonInfoShipTo,ShipToID, PersonInfoMarkFor, CAC, CarrierServiceCode, CarrierAccountNo, DeliveryCode and FreightTerms the value in the template is assigned to the chained order. If there is no value in the ChainedOrderDefaultTemplateOrder, or there is no ChainedOrderDefaultTemplateOrder, values are copied from the parent order.

        Line Schedule information is copied from the parent line to the chained line, regardless of the ChainedOrderDefaultTemplate values. There are several exceptions; these are not copied: SourceFromOrganization, the keys, CreateUser, ModifyUser and timestamp fields.

        If the parent line does not have ShipNode populated and the ChainedOrderDefaultTemplate has an OrderLine/ShipNode attribute, then if the chained line has only one schedule or all schedules of the chained line have the same ShipNode , then
        the ShipNode from the schedule(s) is assigned to the chained line.

        The ChainedFromOrderHeaderKey and ChainedFromOrderLineKey populated in the new chained order, and they refer to the parent order. The HoldFlag is defaulted to N on the chained lines.

        All inventory updates for a chained line are done only based on chained order document settings.

        Creating Procurement Orders

        Procurement orders can be created by createChainedOrder similar to the way scheduleOrder creates procurement orders. Inventory will be updated for both parent and child order. Please see scheduleOrder documentation on how procurement orders are created. Both procurment orders and drop ship chained orders will be created only when the current date is beyond the notification date. Refer to the Product Concepts on how notification date is calculated.

        To work with fractional OrderedQty, set yfs.install.displaydoublequantity to Y in the yfs.properties file.

        Global Trade Item Number (GTIN)
        Selling item is replaced with additional item in chained order when inventory of additional item is used.

        User Exits: This API invokes the user exits


          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSDetermineChainedOrderForConsolidationUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSCheckOrderBeforeProcessingUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVDetermineActualInventoryItemUE

          The createChainedOrder API also invokes all the user exits invoked by createOrder, if a new chained order is being created. The createChainedOrder API can invoke all the user exits invoked by changeOrder if the group of parent lines are being chained to an existing chained order.

        Events Raised: Event raised under the transaction CHAINED_ORDER_CREATE

        ON_SUCCESS This event is raised for the parent order upon successful execution of this api.
        Data published - YFS_CHAINED_ORDER_CREATE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
        Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support
        Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to xml for element level details.


        ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
        Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
        Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support
        Yes.

        Raised under the transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a demand update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a supply update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes

        Audits: Yes
        Audit is done for an existing chained order if a group of parent lines is chained to it by this API.

        Pre-conditions:
        The parent order must exist in the system.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support:
        Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all the nodes except for the following:

          Reference
          PaymentCollectionDetail
          PaymentMethod


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the parent order as well as a list of the chained orders. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
